page.title: 07BROMYARD - ATHIS EXCHANGE
page.content: In 1979, Bromyard received a request from{Ross-on-Wye}for a town to twin with{Athis}in{Normandy, France.}A group of{Queen Elizabeth High School { pupils visited Athis for 2 weeks to stay with French children of the same age. Various trips were organised visiting places of interest. The numbers now vary between 17 and 30 with children{aged 13-15.}The exchange takes place annually in May and June. As a natural extension of the school exchange, the town twinning took place. A group of people from Bromyard visited Athis before the exchange began. In return, some people from Athis came to Bromyard, also before the official start in 1980. The English visit Athis in the Whitson weekend. The French visit Bromyard during the{Gala weekend}in the first week of{July.
